New Records: Dasun Shanaka equalled a joint second most sixes hit in an innings for Sri Lanka in T20 international, jointly with Thisara Perera, Isuru Udana and Bhanuka Rajapaksa and the second most-sixes hit by an Sri Lankan batsman against India in T20Is.

Dasun Shanaka hammered a 20-ball fastest fifty by an Sri Lankan batsman in T20 international cricket history, surpassing the previous record of 21-ball half-century held by Mahela Jayawardene against Kenya at Johannesburg in the inaugural 2007 World Twenty20 and also the fastest fifty by an Sri Lankan batsman against India in T20Is, surpassing the previous record of 21-ball half-century held by Kumar Sangakkara at Nagpur in 2009.
Kusal Mendis hammered a 27-ball his third fastest fifty for Sri Lanka in T20 international and the sixth fastest fifty by an Sri Lankan batsman against India in T20Is.
Sri Lanka's 206 was the highest-score by any team at Pune in T20Is, previous highest was 201 by India against Sri Lanka in 2020.
Key Match Events: Captain Dasun Shanaka's record-breaking 20-ball fastest fifty and Kusal Mendis' blazing half-century, Charith Asalanka's rapid 37 and a first-over double-wicket from Kasun Rajitha sets up to Sri Lanka comprehensive 16-run victory over India, despite a fighting half-centuries from Suryakumar Yadav - Axar Patel

Dasun Shanaka equalled a joint second most sixes hit in an innings for Sri Lanka in T20 international, jointly with Thisara Perera, Isuru Udana and Bhanuka Rajapaksa and the second most-sixes hit by an Sri Lankan batsman against India in T20Is.
Sri Lanka scored 206-6 in 20 overs with top scorer by Dasun Shanaka hammered a unbeaten 56 off 22-balls.
India best bowler by Umran Malik picked up 3-wickets, Axar Patel took 2-wickets and one for Yuzvendra Chahal.
India were 57-5 to scored 190-8 in 20 overs with top scorer by Axar Patel hammered a 65 off 31-balls including 6-sixes & 3-fours with strike rate of 209.67.
Suryakumar Yadav blasted a 51 off 36-balls including 3-sixes & 3-fours with strike rate of 141.66, Shivam Mavi hammered a 26 off 15-balls included 2-sixes & 2-fours with strike rate of 173.33.
Post-Match Reflections: Dasun Shanaka named Player of the match for his match-winning all-round performance to took 2-wickets in the final over of the match and after smashing a power-hitting unbeaten 56-runs knocked off facing 22-balls including 6-sixes and 2-fours with strike rate of 254.54.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pathum Nissanka and Kusal Mendis set up the second highest first-wicket partnership for Sri Lanka against India in T20 international and the Sri Lanka'a fifth highest any-wicket stand against India in T20Is.

Dasun Shanaka and Chamika Karunaratne set up the record seventh-wicket partnership for Sri Lanka against India in T20 international, previously held by the unbeaten 40-run stand between Charith Asalanka and Dushmantha Chameera at Lucknow in the last year and the Sri Lanka's second highest seventh-wicket stand in T20Is.
Sri Lanka's 206 was their second highest score against India in T20 international after their 215 at Nagpur in 2009 and It is their joint seventh highest total in T20Is.
